document_content.title: Referral to Internal Medicine for Further Evaluation

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Preston is being referred for evaluation and management of persistent fatigue and unexplained weight loss over the past three months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports ongoing fatigue, low energy levels, and an unintentional weight loss of approximately 6 kg since February 2025. She also notes intermittent low-grade fevers and occasional night sweats. There is no history of cough, hemoptysis, chest pain, or gastrointestinal symptoms.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic medical conditions. No previous surgeries. No allergies reported.

sections.heading: Family and Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker, does not consume alcohol. Works as a graphic designer. No significant family history of malignancy or autoimmune disorders.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Not currently taking any prescription or over-the-counter medications.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vital signs stable. Physical examination unremarkable except for mild pallor. No palpable lymphadenopathy or organomegaly.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: CBC reveals normocytic anemia (Hb 10.4 g/dL). ESR and CRP mildly elevated. Basic metabolic panel within normal limits. Chest X-ray unremarkable.

sections.heading: Referral Request
sections.content: Given the chronicity of symptoms and abnormal blood work, further evaluation by Internal Medicine is requested to rule out underlying systemic illness.
